text:
Patient is a 39 y/o M w/ etoh abuse, p/w extreme weakness found to have
   wet beri-beri, transferred to ICU on [**3-25**] for hypercarbic respiratory
   failure for altered mental status and fevers, intubated, called-out to
   floor.  On floor, has been getting antibiotics for hospital acquired
   pneumonia.  Hospital course also c/b refeeding syndrome, and altered
   mental status of unclear etiology.
   .
   This AM, patient triggered for second time in 24 hours for increasing
   respiratory rate, tachycardia to 150's.  He was placed on
   non-rebreathter and transferred to ICU for management.
   .
   On arrival to the ICU patient was with HR 131, T98.9, Bp147/82, 30, O2
   96% on 50% FiO2.  Patient was alert, arousable, and denied pain.
   Mental status waxed and waned some during interview
   Fever (Hyperthermia, Pyrexia, not Fever of Unknown Origin)
   Assessment:
   Temp max 103.0 Ax. Currently he is receiving vanco/zosyn/cipro/flagyl
   [**Hospital 6061**] hospital acquired pneumonia.
   Action:
   Cooling blanket placed over patient. Also ice packs were placed.
   Tylenol 650mg po was given. The Tylenol was changed to do not exceed
   2gm in 24hours.
   Response:
   Currently 101.7
   Plan:
   Monitor his temp frequently. Keep the cooling blanket on prn. The has a
   order for the Tylenol. I did get the second blood culture. He was pan
   cultured on admission to micu 6 secondary to his temps.
   Dyspnea (Shortness of breath)
   Assessment:
   Respiratory rate 25to 30. He is a shallow breather, and has a poor
   cough and gag. O2 sat while awake is 95-98% off the face mask. While he
   is sleeping, his o2 sat will drop 90%. He is also on xopenon and
   ipratropium q6 hours. Lung sounds clear bilat.
   Action:
   I did place him back on the face mask. Rt did given the HHN.
   Response:
   O2 sat now 100% on 40% fio2.
   Plan:
   Continue with the face mask and 40%. While he is sleeping, continue
   with hand held nebs.
   Tachycardia, Other
   Assessment:
   Tachy up to the 140 with the temp. but his base line heart rate was
   130. no ectopy noted. Trop 0.04. ekg without ST changes noted. Icu team
   feels the tachycardia is due to the fevers.
   Action:
   Tylenol given. Cooling blanket placed.
   Response:
   Heart rate went down to 135.
   Plan:
   Echo tomorrow. Continue with o2.
   Labs
   Assessment:
   INR 2.1,potassium 3.6. ionized ca 1.11
   Action:
   Phytonadine 5gm po given, potassium 40meq given, and sliding scale
   ionized ca given.
   Response:
   Temp max at 0500 102.3 Ax. Tylenol 650mg given and cooling blanket
   placed. Potassium 3.7. magnesium 1.6. potsssium 40meq given and
   magnesium 2gm iv given. HCT 23.7. which is down from 27.2. He did have
   one large guiac positive stool. ICU team aware, and will discuess it in
   rounds this am.
   06:06
